newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: SNB says M0 grew 3.0 pct in July vs Q4 1995.
newsitem.headline: SNB says M0 grew 3.0 pct in July vs Q4 1995.

text.p: The Swiss National Bank (SNB) said that its central bank money supply aggregate M0 grew on a seasonally adjusted basis by 3.0 percent in July versus the fourth quarter of 1995, or by 4.5 percent if calculated on an annual basis.
It said in an advance summary of its monthly report for the period mid-July to mid-August that M0, on an adjusted basis, totaled 31,156 million Swiss francs.
In its June report, it put M0 at 30,995 million francs, which represented an increase of 2.5 percent versus the fourth quarter, and a 4.3 percent gain calculated on an annual basis.
M0 comprises banks' sight deposits at the National Bank plus notes in circulation.
The SNB said on a monthly average basis, sight deposits in July fell by over 100 million francs to 2,743 million.
Notes in circulation rose by 2.8 percent from the previous month to 28,133 million francs.
